intro: Treculia affona, commonly known as the African breadfruit, is a tropical tree native to Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and smooth, gray bark. The tree produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers followed by oval, woody fruits. The fruit contains a single large seed enclosed in a starchy, edible pulp, which is used as a food source in some regions. It is also valued for its timber and has traditional medicinal uses in various African cultures.
